intro: Claytonia polypetala, commonly known as the pink rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or white and bloom in early spring. Claytonia polypetala is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
